title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
Sylius 1.12.13 is vulnerable to Cross Site Scripting (XSS) via the "Province" field in Address Book.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-29376
  • https://github.com/r2tunes/Reports/blob/main/Sylius.md
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mw82-6m2g-qh6c
items.title: [sylius/sylius] Sylius Cross Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability

items.content_html:
Cross Site Request Forgery (CSRF) in CART option in OpenCart Ltd. Opencart CMS 3.0.3.6 allows attacker to add cart items via Add to cart.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2020-28838
  • https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49228
  • https://www.opencart.com
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3j6m-m5v5-9785
items.title: [opencart/opencart] OpenCart Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
/upload/catalog/controller/account/password.php in OpenCart through 3.0.2.0 has CSRF via the index.php?route=account/password URI to change a user's password.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-13067
  • https://whitehatck01.blogspot.com/2018/06/opencart-v3-0-3-0-user-changes-password.html
  • https://github.com/opencart/opencart/issues/6912
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-jwqr-jcwp-445w
items.title: [opencart/opencart] OpenCart Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
The "program extension upload" feature in OpenCart through 3.0.2.0 has a six-step process (upload, install, unzip, move, xml, remove) that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code if the remove step is skipped, because the attacker can discover a secret temporary directory name (containing 10 random digits) via a directory traversal attack involving language_info['code'].

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11494
  • http://www.bigdiao.cc/2018/05/24/Opencart-v3-0-2-0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-wx3q-f5f2-4q8v
items.title: [opencart/opencart] OpenCart Path Traversal

items.content_html:
OpenCart through 3.0.2.0 allows directory traversal in the editDownload function in admin\model\catalog\download.php via admin/index.php?route=catalog/download/edit, related to the download_id. For example, an attacker can download ../../config.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-11495
  • http://www.bigdiao.cc/2018/05/24/Opencart-v3-0-2-0
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-qgrf-34hp-ghm9
items.title: [opencart/opencart] OpenCart Path Traversal

items.content_html:
QuickApps CMS version 2.0.0 is vulnerable to Stored Cross-site Scripting in the user's real name field resulting in denial of service and performing unauthorised actions with an administrator user's account

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000495
  • https://github.com/quickapps/cms/issues/183
  • https://github.com/quickapps/cms/commit/7d648f21bd87af8263dcd6449f0946a2dd31348a
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-825g-f3g2-6vxf
items.title: [quickapps/cms] QuickApps CMS Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
CSRF in /admin/user/manage/add in QuickAppsCMS 2.0.0-beta2 allows an unauthorized remote attacker to create an account with admin privileges.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-9108
  • https://github.com/quickapps/cms/issues/187
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-62g2-8p9f-ghjp
items.title: [quickapps/cms] QuickAppsCMS Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in QuickAppsCMS (aka QACMS) through 2.0.0-beta2. A CSRF vulnerability can change the administrator password via the user/me URI.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-17102
  • https://github.com/quickapps/cms/issues/187
  • https://github.com/quickapps/cms/issues/199
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-3p9v-xp6w-wcmc
items.title: [quickapps/cms] QuickAppsCMS Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in the Paymorrow module 1.0.0 before 1.0.2 and 2.0.0 before 2.0.1 for OXID eShop. An attacker can bypass delivery-address change detection if the payment module doesn't use eShop's checkout procedure properly. To do so, the attacker must change the delivery address to one that is not verified by the Paymorrow module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14020
  • https://bugs.oxid-esales.com/view.php?id=6801
  • https://oxidforge.org/en/security-bulletin-2018-003.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-489x-ccjw-q7c4
items.title: [oxid-esales/paymorrow-module] Paymorrow Improper Input Validation vulnerability

items.content_html:
An issue was discovered in the Paymorrow module 1.0.0 before 1.0.2 and 2.0.0 before 2.0.1 for OXID eShop. An attacker can bypass delivery-address change detection if the payment module doesn't use eShop's checkout procedure properly. To do so, the attacker must change the delivery address to one that is not verified by the Paymorrow module.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-14020
  • https://bugs.oxid-esales.com/view.php?id=6801
  • https://oxidforge.org/en/security-bulletin-2018-003.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-489x-ccjw-q7c4
items.title: [oxid-esales/paymorrow-module] Paymorrow Improper Input Validation vulnerability

items.content_html:
LightSAML version prior to 1.3.5 contains a Incorrect Access Control vulnerability in signature validation in readers in src/LightSaml/Model/XmlDSig/ that can result in impersonation of any user from Identity Provider. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 1.3.5 and later.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-1000165
  • https://github.com/lightSAML/lightSAML/commit/47cef07bb09779df15620799f3763d1b8d32307a
  • https://github.com/lightSAML/lightSAML/releases/tag/1.3.5
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-vg4f-8v9q-5c3x
items.title: [lightsaml/lightsaml] LightSAML Incorrect Access Control vulnerability

items.content_html:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.3-p2 (and earlier), 2.3.7-p3 (and earlier) and 2.4.4 (and earlier) are affected by an improper input validation vulnerability. An authenticated attacker can trigger an insecure direct object reference in the V1/customers/me endpoint to achieve information exposure and privilege escalation.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-42344
  • https://helpx.adobe.com/security/products/magento/apsb22-38.html
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-297f-r9w7-w492
items.title: [magento/community-edition] Magento Improper input validation vulnerability

items.content_html:
Adobe Commerce versions 2.4.3-p2 (and earlier), 2.3.7-p3 (and earlier) and 2.4.4 (and earlier) are affected by an improper input validation vulnerability. An authenticated attacker can trigger an insecure direct object reference in the V1/customers/me endpoint to achieve information exposure and privilege escalation.

items.content_html:
MODX Revolution version 2.x - 2.5.6 is vulnerable to blind SQL injection caused by improper sanitization by the escape method resulting in authenticated user accessing database and possibly escalating privileges.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-1000067
  • https://github.com/modxcms/revolution/blob/9bf1c6cf7bdc12190b404f93ce7798b39c07bc59/core/xpdo/changelog.txt
  • https://github.com/modxcms/revolution/blob/2.x/core/xpdo/changelog.txt#L48
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-phhm-6pgm-mxw9
items.title: [modx/revolution] MODX Revolution blind SQL injection

items.content_html:
Yab Quarx before 2.4.5 is prone to multiple persistent cross-site scripting vulnerabilities: Blog (Title), FAQ (Question), Pages (Title), Widgets (Name), and Menus (Name).

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2018-7274
  • https://github.com/YABhq/Quarx/issues/116
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/103081
  • https://github.com/GrafiteInc/CMS/issues/115
  • https://github.com/GrafiteInc/CMS/commit/dcc1a5ac3c6d48afd3b8b9d8b11a9c6bfeb75f77
  • http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2018/Feb/53
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h4fh-gpvh-753g
items.title: [yab/quarx] Yab Quarx persistent cross-site scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
Drupal core 8 before versions 8.3.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code due to the PECL YAML parser not handling PHP objects safely during certain operations.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6920
  • https://www.drupal.org/forum/newsletters/security-advisories-for-drupal-core/2017-06-21/drupal-core-multiple
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99211
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038781
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2017-6920.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2017-6920.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2017-003
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9c24-g32g-35rj
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal PECL YAML parser unsafe object handling

items.content_html:
Drupal core 8 before versions 8.3.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code due to the PECL YAML parser not handling PHP objects safely during certain operations.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2017-6920
  • https://www.drupal.org/forum/newsletters/security-advisories-for-drupal-core/2017-06-21/drupal-core-multiple
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/99211
  • http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1038781

  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2017-6920.yaml
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2017-003
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-9c24-g32g-35rj
items.title: [drupal/core] Drupal PECL YAML parser unsafe object handling

items.content_html:
The user password reset form in Drupal 8.x before 8.2.3 allows remote attackers to conduct cache poisoning attacks by leveraging failure to specify a correct cache context.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-9450
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2016-005
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94367
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2016-9450.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2016-9450.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-98w5-wqp9-w466
items.title: [drupal/drupal] Drupal Incorrect cache context on password reset page

items.content_html:
The user password reset form in Drupal 8.x before 8.2.3 allows remote attackers to conduct cache poisoning attacks by leveraging failure to specify a correct cache context.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-9450
  • https://www.drupal.org/SA-CORE-2016-005
  • http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/94367
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/core/CVE-2016-9450.yaml
  • https://github.com/FriendsOfPHP/security-advisories/blob/master/drupal/drupal/CVE-2016-9450.yaml
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-98w5-wqp9-w466
items.title: [drupal/core] Drupal Incorrect cache context on password reset page
